definition: to avoid (esp. responsibility)/to shift (the blame)/to pass the buck
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to unload/to unhitch/to remove or strip/to get rid of

sentences.english: We do not blame a client for shortcomings in our advertizing.
sentences.chinese: 我们从不把广告的缺点推卸给客户。

sentences.english: He wormed out of giving a lecture that afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 那天下午他把做讲座的差事推卸掉了。

sentences.english: Remember, though, that you can delegate the authority, but you cannot delegate the responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 记住，虽然你可以授权，但是你不可以推卸责任。

sentences.english: The manager divested himself of all reponsibility for the decision.
sentences.chinese: 经理推卸了自己对做出这个决定的所有责任。

sentences.english: Passing the buck is a way of life in large bureaucracies.
sentences.chinese: 推卸责任是大官僚机构里司空见惯的事。

sentences.english: And once you start a business, there's nowhere to pass the buck.
sentences.chinese: 而且，一旦你开始创业后，就没有地方让你推卸责任。

sentences.english: They may deny responsibility and became moody, volatile or angry.
sentences.chinese: 他们可能推卸责任，变得不快，动辄发脾气。

sentences.english: Your disavowal is informed by a misunderstanding.
sentences.chinese: 你的推卸是由一种误解造成的。

sentences.english: China's buck-passing rhetoric does no one any favours.
sentences.chinese: 中国推卸责任对任何人都没有好处。

sentences.english: There must be something wrong with this machine,you can't wriggle out of it.
sentences.chinese: 一定是这台机器出了毛病，对此你不能推卸责任。

sentences.english: In my naivete , I blamed this on my teachers.
sentences.chinese: 那时的我，只是天真地将责任推卸给老师。

sentences.english: Meanwhile，bad weather could be a good excuse to refuse the responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 此外，不良气候也是可以推卸责任的最佳理由。

sentences.english: Clear responsibility for your own positions, do not shirk, do not escape.
sentences.chinese: 明确自身的岗位责任并身体力行，不推卸，不逃避。

sentences.english: Go ahead try it, I dare you.
sentences.chinese: 我敢说你不会去尝试推卸。

sentences.english: But I hold the responsibility that can't be shirked in international dispute.
sentences.chinese: 但国际争端我则负有不可推卸的责任。

definition: to decline/to avoid/shirking responsibilities/to blame others/to pass the buck/to unload one's responsibilities/to try to get out of a task
to put the blame on/to accuse
to lose one's job/unemployment/not to fulfill one's obligations/to neglect one's job/dereliction of duty
cannot escape censure (idiom)/has to bear the blame
to take one's anger out on sb (who does not deserve it)
